moves.1. d4 c5 2. c4: better is d5 and to transport into Benoni or Benko gambit.
moves.5. Nxc6 bxc6 6. Qb3 Qb6 7. Qxb6: a positional mistake. why opening a file for black?
moves.7... axb6 8. e4 Nf6 9. Nc3 Bb4 10. Bd2 d: with Be6 and d5, breaking through the center.
moves.11. f3 O-O 12. g4: I think that Be2 with 0-0 and a3 is more safe.
moves.12... Be6 13. h4 Ra7: wants the a file and the a pawn...
moves.21. Na2 Nc5: the knight is getting into the party too.
moves.22. Nb4 Bd7 23. Kc2 Na4 24. Nd3 c5: nothing will move that bishop from d4.
moves.25. Bf2 b5: breaking through the queenside ng open files a and soon b.
moves.26. cxb5 Bxb5 27. Bxd4 Bxd3+ 28. Bxd3 cx: there are now two pawns in favour of white in the queen side but I dont see how white can hold them both.
moves.29. Bc4+ Kf8 30. Rdb1 Rc7 31. Kd3 Rb8 32: these exchanges are not good for black...
? first of all Rb2 is needed and then white can move on with his two pawns.
moves.38... Kd7 39. b4 Kc6 40. b5+ Kb6 41. Ra1: Rc1 must be considered. I cant see how white defends his h6 pawn.
